newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli warplanes strike in south Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Israeli warplanes strike in south Lebanon.

text.p: Israeli warplanes rocketed suspected Hizbollah targets in south Lebanon on Monday, security source said.
Security sources said two warplanes fired four rockets into the area of Ain Qana in Iqlim al-Toufah -- a pro-Iranian Hizbollah stronghold used for attacks on Israeli forces and their militia allies.
There was no immediate report of casualties in the air assault which came hours after Hizbollah guerrillas fired rocket-ropelled grenades and machineguns at a pro-Israeli outpost in Jizzine.

Pro-Israeli South Lebanon Army (SLA) militia sources said no one was injured in the attack. Jizzine is a strip of land officially outside Israel's 15 km (nine miles)-wide south Lebanon occupation zone but under SLA control.
